qas.question: What did the ECB do to help stabilise the financial system during the subprime mortgage crisis?

answers.text: loaned billions of euros to banks

qas.question: Why did the ECB intervene during the subprime mortgage crisis?
Who decided, along with the ECB, to use Term auction to help stabilize the financial crisis and improve dollar liquidity?
Besides cooperating with other financial institutions, how does the ECB help to maintain stability?

answers.text: contributes to maintaining a stable financial system and monitoring the banking sector

qas.question: When did the ECB and Federal Rserve decide to collaborate on Term auction facility?

plausible_answers.text: loaned billions of euros to banks

qas.question: What did the ECB avoid to help stabilize the financial system during the subprime mortgage crisis?
Why did the ECB not intervene during the subprime mortgage crisis?
Who rejected, along with the ECB, to use Term auction to help stabilize the financial crisis and improve dollar liquidity?
When did the ECB and Federal Reserve decide to separate on Term auction facility?

plausible_answers.text: contributes to maintaining a stable financial system and monitoring the banking sector

qas.question: How does the ECB help to destroy stability?

context: The bank must also co-operate within the EU and internationally with third bodies and entities. Finally, it <a3_0><b9_0>contributes to maintaining a stable financial system and monitoring the banking sector<b9_0/><a3_0/>. The latter can be seen, for example, in the bank's intervention during the subprime mortgage crisis when it <a0_0><b5_0>loaned billions of euros to banks<b5_0/><a0_0/> <a1_0><b6_0>to stabilise the financial system<b6_0/><a1_0/>. In <a4_0><b8_0>December 2007<b8_0/><a4_0/>, the ECB decided in conjunction with the <a2_0><b7_0>Federal Reserve System<b7_0/><a2_0/> under a programme called Term auction facility to improve dollar liquidity in the eurozone and to stabilise the money market.
